todos.title: Bias
todos.body: The objective of science is that all empirical data that has been gathered through observation, experience and experimentation is without bias.

todos.title: Qualitative research
todos.body: Often used in the social sciences, examines the reasons behind human behavior. It involves data that can be found using the human senses. This type of research is often done in the beginning of an experiment.

todos.title: Quantitative research
todos.body: Involves methods that are used to collect numerical data and analyze it using statistical methods.  This type of research is often used at the end of an experiment to refine and test the previous research.

todos.title: Empirical evidence
todos.body: Information acquired by observation or experimentation.

todos.title: Hypothesis
todos.body: Every scientific theory starts as a hypothesis. A hypothesis is an idea that hasnt been proven yet.

todos.title: Design Process
todos.body: Before any pieces of empirical data are collected, scientists carefully design their research methods to ensure the accuracy, quality and integrity of the data.

todos.title: An experiment should include a dependent variable (which does not change) and an independent variable (which does change).
An experiment should include an experimental group and a control group. The control group is what the experimental group is compared against.

Research must involve deductive reasoning and inductive reasoning. Deductive reasoning is the process of using true premises to reach a logical true conclusion while inductive reasoning takes the opposite approach.
The hypothesis must be testable and falsifiable, according to North Carolina State University. Falsifiable means that there must be a possible negative answer to the hypothesis.
